availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Special Term Greenup County Court
Tuesday September 23d 1862

It is ordered that a rule issue against John C Adams late Presiding Judge of Greenup County Court returnable instanter to Shew cause if any he hath or can have why he retained in his possession and does not and will not produce to and file in this Court a Statement of the indebtedness of Greenup County made out by George E Roe and Jeremiah Davidson Esqe Commissioners appointed by the Court for that purpose

A Copy
Attest John S. Jones C. G. C. C.
